Next, I need to evaluate the potential effects of each change on the start codon.

A single nucleotide substitution of the nucleotide occupying the first codon position (choice c) could result in a different start codon, such as AUU or AUC, which would still be recognized as a start codon by the ribosome. This would likely have a minimal effect on protein synthesis.
A single nucleotide substitution of the nucleotide occupying the third codon position (choice d) would not affect the start codon, as the start codon is determined by the first two nucleotides.
